snippet: Although China’s economic boom has created millions of well-paying jobs, its skilled workers are moving elsewhere, in search of better quality of life, and religious and political freedoms.
abstract: Many of China's skilled workers are leaving country, despite economic boom that has created millions of well-paying jobs, searching for better quality of life, and religious and political freedoms; 2010 statistics show that 508,000 Chinese left for 34 developed countries that make up Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, increase of 45 percent over 2000; United States received 87,000 permanent residents from China in 2011.

byline.contributor: Amy Qin, Adam Century and Patrick Zuo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Although China’s economic boom has created millions of well-paying jobs, its skilled workers are moving elsewhere, in search of better quality of life, and religious and political freedoms.
